page.title: 13The Wildlife of Shoreham
page.content: Widewater was probably left where once the whole area was covered. During the course of time seaweed, shingle and mud have formed a bank which still remains. This bank has been artificially improved to give protection against flooding, although it has been breached in two places in recent years. Widewater is a good place for ornithologists as there is a large population of birds some which stay all the year round. Many birds use the area of fresh water during migration as a stopover, although many can only be seen in the mornings and late evenings due to the disturbances caused by residential housing which faces onto a very busy main road. The saltmarshes in Shoreham are also very important for the wildlife they support. The wading birds to whom
